intro: Chiloschista treubii, commonly known as the Java moss, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the family Fontinaliaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and its ability to thrive in freshwater environments. The plant typically has short, branching stems with small, ovate leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, silky hairs. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in slow-moving streams and ponds. Due to its hardy nature, it is popular in aquariums and water gardens as a decorative and functional plant.
